meanings.definition: To cover or pave with shales.
meanings.sent1: The workers shaled the pathway with flat rocks.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew shaled the driveway for a smooth surface.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully shaled the ground with colorful pebbles.
meanings.sent4: The artist shaled the canvas with different textures to create a unique effect.
meanings.sent5: The gardener shaled the garden path to make it more visually appealing.

meanings.sent1: The geologist explained how the rock shaled over time.
meanings.sent2: The old building shaled due to weathering and erosion.
meanings.sent3: The cake shaled into perfect slices when cut.
meanings.sent4: The old book's pages shaled apart from frequent use.
meanings.sent5: The tree bark shaled off in thin strips during the dry season.
